quote: I use it for replying to admin-related emails.
I use it to help family members who are requesting assistance.
Recently, someone wanted help with the board charter, so I assisted with that.
I also use transcription and dictation a lot, taking notes using AI and then reflecting on those notes.
I'm using it for taking notes on the go. I use a tool called WhisperFlow that is quite good at transcription, so I can just talk to my laptop and it takes those notes.
A lot of the time, I'm speaking directly into chat as well.
I think it was just around actually using another tool called Retul, and I was trying to create an AI agent using AI. I spent a while battling away at that task and didn't really get anywhere.
Perhaps the task is too complex for AI to create from scratch, and I probably should have set the context more clearly.
I was trying to force everything into one or two prompts, and it's probably better to break that out further. So, I think some of it might just be my learning about AI and how to use it quickly.
I think, yeah, for me, voice dictation is important, and then the ability to understand those notes and actually take action on them when the time is right.

say I take a note about adding something to the shopping list, if it could actually go ahead and understand that request and then do the order itself or add it to my weekly list within my online shopping order, that would be pretty cool.
Daily activities would include being able to reply to emails by speaking in my own words, while still having the emails written in my tone and style.
It would be great to have the assistant actually send those emails as well.

I think it would look for gaps in the calendar and make some informed guesses about the best times to schedule those sorts of tasks. Then, it would add that time to my calendar, send me a notification, and send reminders, etc.
So, just having control of that calendar and an understanding of the tasks would be great.
Ideally, it would just be one voice interface, and I maybe don't even need to see the calendar.
I just get a daily update email with what's coming up today and some stuff I've prepared to help you get ready for those things.
Yeah, and just linking through to various systems, maybe within Google Workspace, but other tools as well.

I had no real concerns. I was maybe expecting that when I was being interviewed by AI, it would be more of a conversation. I thought it would have a voice speaking to me in a more conversational tone, not like a typeform survey.
Although, there's no ability to go back, so I can't change my answers.
ChatGPT has a feature around just being able to converse with AI. I think that would be yeah. I think that would be a good option.
I think just human tone of voice and, speed to ask those follow-up questions. Yeah. Just making it more of a human style chat would be good.
